terminologie_extrait.definition: Certain 'different' shots that are not the norm.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: Used to describe different techniques or variations in table tennis.

debutant.description: Throw in a few forehand pendulum or backhand serves from the forehand side. The surprise factor will often make up for your starting a bit out of position.

debutant.nom: Serve short sidespin to the forehand
debutant.description: Instead, learn to serve short to the forehand with sidespin that pulls the ball toward your forehand, making it awkward for the opponent to return the ball down the line.

intermediaire.description: Try letting the ball drop a bit more, and go for a super-spinny slow one. If it goes deep, it'll drive blockers crazy.
Fake spin, and instead give a dead loop. You sell this by using an exaggerated follow-through right after contact (including a big wrist snap), making it seem spinny.

avance.description: Sometimes try a flatter one. Hit it a bit softer since you don't have topspin to pull it down, but not too soft.

exercices_complementaires.description: Most players push to keep the ball in play. Throw in a few super-ginzo (i.e. extremely heavy) pushes, and watch opponents struggle.
Rather than bang every ball in a fast counter-hitting rally, sometimes hit one soft. Either keep it low and short to the net, or deep on the table.

erreurs_a_eviter.description: Opponents may struggle to return a super-ginzo push or a slow, spinny loop.
